intro: Anthocercis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anthocercis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
